name: michael nissen
text: i had a great experience at the frerret location. The staff was great and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend for anybody in the area to at least try it out.

name: Hal Doueck
text: Probably the best pizza we've found in New Orleans. Everything is very uniform, from the dough weight to the oven temperature, the owner/manager keeps things pretty consistent. There is no wood oven like we'd expect (coming from NY), but ‚Ä¶More

name: Dee
text: It kinda "is what it is." Pizza is good salads are good, service a bit lazy at times, but its a small step up from fast food. It wont stop me from eating here, but the lack of ambition in the staff is noticeable.

name: hippybonus
text: I came to order ‚Äúbuild your own pizza‚Äù, which is supposed that I can put as many toppings as I want. By the time I asked for the forth meat, the worker said ‚Äúit‚Äôs too full, you can‚Äôt add any more‚Äù. After that, I asked for some of the ‚Ä¶More

name: Kit Nichabond
text: Visited New Orleans this pat week and just had to go to my fav pizza joint. The location here is small compared to the one in North Texas. I had so much fun in New orleans even though everything is closed. Oh yeah, this review is about pizza lol. Pizza is great, thank you Blaze!

name: Blake Becnel
text: Delicious, as always! Staff was all smiles and seemed very appreciative that I chose to do business with them. Will definitely visit this location (Freret St.) again because of the great experience!

name: Hector Pe√±a, Jr.
text: Even during a lunch rush, with orders piling up, the employees moved efficiently and were extremely friendly. Thanks so much to the manager for being simultaneously empathetic and professional. I‚Äôll definitely return here with friends.

name: Kristin Robair
text: This is such a great location to visit. The staff was nice and the service was very efficient. I got my food pretty quickly. The pizza is totally delicious. The cauliflower crust is AMAZING! It was light and crisp. I will come back to visit.

name: David Schwarz
text: The pizza was terrible. The dough was undercooked and the toppings were poor. They did not follow my instructions. Before covet 19 I used to enjoy going there and building your own Pizza. I was in The Gourmet Pizza business over 30 years, ‚Ä¶More

text: Amazing thin crust pizza. It's cooked in a wood fired oven which makes its crisp. The build your own option is amazing if you like pizza with lot of toppings. Their garlic pesto drizzle is a must try.

name: Brandon Barger
text: The options for building your own pizza are great. Staff was friendly.  Quick service. Delicious. We‚Äôll be back!

I Never knew such a place existed! Now that I know I'm not going to be able to get it out of my head!

name: Bobbi Burns
text: I went to this location yesterday and the new General Manager Sam, was amazing! He was very knowledgeable and helpful during my order and had such a positive attitude. I will definitely be coming back, and telling my friends and co workers to come here too.

name: blaise singleton
text: I made my order online and when I went into the restaurant to pick up my order the cashier was surly. The food is overpriced for the small portion size. They‚Äôre under staffed and I do NOT recommend either of the Blaze Pizza locations in the city.

text: UGH BLAZE IS THE BEST. I cant tell you how much I love Blaze. Where else can get unlimited delicious, fresh ingredients for only 8.99. The restaurant is always clean and even if they have a line out the door they'll knock the line out in minutes.

text: Love that I can get a pizza, the way I want it.

name: Ashley m
text: The pizza is really good. You don't wait long to get your pizza and the staff is really nice and they explain things to you. Very pleasant atmosphere.
